item.title: OpenAI, Anthropic, Google may disrupt education market with new AI tools
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: AI companies could soon disrupt the education market with their new AI-based learning tools for students. [...]

item.title: New CrushFTP zero-day exploited in attacks to hijack servers
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: CrushFTP is warning that threat actors are actively exploiting a zero-day vulnerability tracked as CVE-2025-54309, which allows attackers to gain administrative access via the web interface on vulnerable servers. [...]

item.title: Arch Linux pulls AUR packages that installed Chaos RAT malware
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Arch Linux has pulled three malicious packages uploaded to the Arch User Repository (AUR) were used to install the CHAOS remote access trojan (RAT) on Linux devices. [...]

item.title: UK ties GRU to stealthy Microsoft 365 credential-stealing malware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The UK National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) has formally attributed 'Authentic Antics' espionage malware attacks to APT28 (Fancy Bear), threat actor already linked to Russia's military intelligence service (GRU). [...]

item.title: Microsoft mistakenly tags Windows Firewall error log bug as fixed
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Microsoft has mistakenly tagged an ongoing Windows Firewall error message bug as fixed in recent updates, stating that they are still working on a resolution. [...]

item.title: New ChatGPT o3-alpha model hints at coding upgrade
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: ChatGPT's o3 is OpenAI's best model to date because it features reasoning, and it might get even better in the next update. [...]

item.title: Russian alcohol retailer WineLab closes stores after ransomware attack
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: WineLab, the retail store of the largest alcohol company in Russia, has closed its stores following a cyberattack that is impacting its operations and causing purchase problems to its customers. [...]

item.title: New Phobos and 8base ransomware decryptor recover files for free
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The Japanese police have released a Phobos and 8-Base ransomware decryptor that lets victims recover their files for free, with BleepingComputer confirming that it successfully decrypts files. [...]

item.title: Hackers scanning for TeleMessage Signal clone flaw exposing passwords
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Researchers are seeing exploitation attempts for the CVE-2025-48927 vulnerability in the TeleMessage SGNL app, which allows retrieving usernames, passwords, and other sensitive data. [...]

item.title: OpenAI: GPT-5 is coming, "we'll see" if it creates a shockwave
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: OpenAI's next foundational and state-of-the-art model, GPT-5, is still on its way after a delay. OpenAI won't tell us the release date for now. [...]

item.title: Citrix Bleed 2 exploited weeks before PoCs as Citrix denied attacks
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: A critical Citrix NetScaler vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-5777 and dubbed "CitrixBleed 2," was actively exploited nearly two weeks before proof-of-concept (PoC) exploits were made public, despite Citrix stating that there was no evidence of attacks. [...]

item.title: VMware fixes four ESXi zero-day bugs exploited at Pwn2Own Berlin
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: VMware fixed four vulnerabilities in VMware ESXi, Workstation, Fusion, and Tools that were exploited as zero-days during the Pwn2Own Berlin 2025 hacking contest in May 2025. [...]

item.title: Microsoft Teams voice calls abused to push Matanbuchus malware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Matanbuchus malware loader has been seen being distributed through social engineering over Microsoft Teams calls impersonating IT helpdesk. [...]
